fields.headline: What the bookies say
fields.bodyText: IDS to lose vote outright 1/16, to win 7/1. The pretenders to the throne: Michael Howard 6/4 David Davis 3/1 Kenneth Clarke 5/1 Oliver Letwin 8/1 Michael Portillo 16/1 Liam Fox 16/1 Michael Ancram 16/1 Tim Yeo 16/1 William Hague 33/1 Ann Widdecombe 50/1 Francis Maude 50/1 · Spread-betting firm IG Index was predicting Mr Duncan Smith would receive the support of between 63 and 68 MPs in tomorrow's vote - well short of the 83 he needs if all 165 MPs cast their ballots. Under spread-betting rules, punters can bet "high" or "low" - above or below the betting firm's predicted range - and win, or lose, multiples of their stake depending on how far the result deviates from the price offered by IG.
